alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dutchess; Greene; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 11:42PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Columbia, Dutchess, Greene and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, New Paltz, Hudson, Ellenville, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hunter, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Hurley, Woodstock, Highland, Red Hook, Athens, West Hurley and Lake Katrine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
